body: I'd assume when you clone https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit and then run `cargo run --example window`, you get the same crash?

Everything seems to work fine with `winit`
```
[11:42] zer0:winit (master) $ cargo run --example window
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.04s
     Running `target/debug/examples/window`
NewEvents(Init)
EventsCleared
NewEvents(WaitCancelled { start: Instant { tv_sec: 2492, tv_nsec: 564817985 }, requested_resume: None })
WindowEvent { window_id: WindowId(X(WindowId(54525953))), event: Resized(LogicalSize { width: 1186.0, height: 1038.0 }) }
WindowEvent { window_id: WindowId(X(WindowId(54525953))), event: RedrawRequested }
WindowEvent { window_id: WindowId(X(WindowId(54525953))), event: Focused(true) }
...
```

No luck with #2438 
```sh
[11:53] zer0:alacritty (master) $ cargo run
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.09s
     Running `target/debug/alacritty`
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: validate_hidpi_factor(dpi_factor)', /home/zer0/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/winit-0.19.1/src/platform/linux/x11/util/randr.rs:36:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.
```

`winit v0.19.1` does give me the same error
```
[12:10] zer0:winit-0.19.1 $ cargo run --example window
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.03s
     Running `target/debug/examples/window`
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: validate_hidpi_factor(dpi_factor)', src/platform/linux/x11/util/randr.rs:36:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.
```

I did not. Adding it has no affect.
```
[12:33] zer0 $ xrdb -query -all
Xft.dpi:        96
[12:33] zer0 $ alacritty
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: validate_hidpi_factor(dpi_factor)', /build/.cargo/git/checkouts/winit-081229dbb0c89e9b/57680d2/src/platform/linux/x11/util/randr.rs:36:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.
```
Odd, would you mind restarting x11/rebooting. The assertion that was triggered can be reached if winit fails to retrieve Xft.dpi.

No change
```sh
User: zer0
 Uptime: 1 minute
 Version: 5.2.4-arch1-1-ARCH GNU/Linux
 Storage:
        /        46G / 475G  11%
 Network:
        wlp2s0  10.1.10.232
        wlp2s0  2603:3004:3a:d800::70
        wlp2s0  2603:3004:3a:d800:e898:b87e:4a9c:92ab

[12:46] zer0 $ alacritty
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: validate_hidpi_factor(dpi_factor)', /build/.cargo/git/checkouts/winit-081229dbb0c89e9b/57680d2/src/platform/linux/x11/util/randr.rs:36:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.
```

I am using [a minimal display manager](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/CDM) and [xmonad](https://xmonad.org/) as my window manager. Not sure if that means anything.
Could you try this one `env WINIT_HIDPI_FACTOR=1 alacritty`?
That worked! The virtual display must not be picking up the settings correctly.

If winit works, but v0.19.1 doesn't, that sounds like it has been fixed in the latest winit. Could you test the latest glutin (https://github.com/rust-windowing/glutin) and downgrading glutin to the latest release in case the latest master works.
Are you *positive* you've tested #2438? The text in the code snippet says you're on your master branch.

Oh nice catch! Forgot to checkout the branch after cloning the fork. 

That runs perfectly! @chrisduerr
Thanks for checking again, then everything makes sense. Marking this issue as fixed by the mentioned PR.

issue.title: Update to winit/glutin EventLoop 2.0
issue.body:
This takes the latest glutin master to port Alacritty to the EventLoop
2.0 rework.

This changes a big part of the event loop handling by pushing the event
loop in a separate thread from the renderer and running both in
parallel.

TODO:
 - [x] Resize issues (https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/2438#issuecomment-505518232)
 - [x] `run_return` support for macOS (https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1005)
 - [x] Resizing extremely slow
 - [x] Font size change not updating pty size
 - [x] Message bar does not update PTY size properly
 - [x] Incorrect window dimensions when moving Alacritty between different DPI monitors
 - [x] Font size not updating when moving Alacritty between different DPI monitors
 - [x] Clean up code / resolve remaining TODOs
 - [x] Incorrect startup DPI on X11 (https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/998)
    -> ~~:zap: Still broken when spawning a floating window in i3~~
    -> Workaround implemented
 - [x] Make sure before merging all the linked issues have change log entries
 - [x] Clear errors on message bar reload

Fixes #2796.
Fixes #2694.
Fixes #2643.
Fixes #2625.
Fixes #2618.
Fixes #2601.
Fixes #2564.
Fixes #2456.
Fixes #2438.
Fixes #2334.
Fixes #2254.
Fixes #2217.
Fixes #1789.
Fixes #1750.
Fixes #1125.
